intro: [WRONG START] Embilia floribunda, commonly known as the fragrant embelia, is a small evergreen shrub native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its dense, aromatic foliage and clusters of small, white, fragrant flowers that bloom throughout the year. The plant produces small, round berries that are typically red when mature, containing several seeds. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical forests. Its botanical features make it a valuable species for both ornamental and ecological purposes.
